item.title: 阿里巴巴支持的人工智能初创公司智璞目标最快于 2025 年上市
item.description: 智付已邀请中国国际金融有限公司（China International Capital Corp）牵头，最快将于今年进行首次公开募股，力争成为几家著名的 ChatGPT 竞争对手中首家进入公开市场的公司。【原文：Zhipu has enlisted China International Capital Corp. to spearhead an initial public offering as soon as this year, angling to become the first of several prominent ChatGPT-competitors to tap public markets.】

item.title: 前官员称日本央行可能暂时搁置加息计划
item.description: 据一位前执行董事称，由于美国的关税措施可能会对日本经济造成打击，因此存在不确定性，日本央行可能会暂时搁置加息。【原文：The Bank of Japan will probably leave aside raising interest rates for now due to uncertainties stemming from US tariff measures that could deal a blow to Japan’s economy, according to a former executive director.】

item.title: 据说台湾竞购者正在围攻 AMD ZT 服务器资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，仁宝电子公司、纬创资通附属公司 Wiwynn Corp.和美国捷普公司（Jabil Inc.【原文：Compal Electronics Inc., Wistron Corp. affiliate Wiwynn Corp. and US company Jabil Inc. are set to submit revised offers for Advanced Micro Devices Inc.’s AI server assembly plants, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 台湾与 Astranis 计划利用互联网卫星消除停电威胁
item.description: 美国一家卫星初创公司将发射第一颗专门用于台湾的通信卫星，这将加强台湾这个自治民主国家的抵御能力，以防中国在入侵台湾时企图实施信息封锁。【原文：A US satellite startup will launch the first communications satellite dedicated to Taiwan, strengthening the self-ruled democracy’s resilience against possible Chinese attempts to impose an information blackout in the event of an invasion.】

item.title: 中国与美国脱钩导致主要石油产品贸易崩溃
item.description: 中国以一系列令人瞠目的征税来回应美国的关税才刚刚过去几天，但石油市场的一个角落已经陷入危机，因为这两个重量级国家之间的双边贸易崩溃了。【原文：It’s been just days since China responded to US tariffs with its own set of eye-watering levies, but one corner of the petroleum market is already in crisis as bilateral trade collapses between the two heavyweights.】

item.title: 耐克将在中国新建上海工作室
item.description: 耐克公司将在上海开设一家新的创意工作室，这家全球最大的运动服装公司将向其最重要的市场之一进行投资。【原文：Nike Inc. is opening a new creative studio in Shanghai as the world’s largest sportswear company pumps investment into one of its most crucial markets.】

item.title: 韩国公布经济刺激计划，关税小组准备美国之行
item.description: 韩国公布了一项 12 万亿韩元（约合 84 亿美元）的补充预算计划，以支撑该国受到唐纳德-特朗普关税威胁的依赖出口的经济，韩国官员正准备前往美国谈判降低关税。【原文：South Korea unveiled a 12 trillion won ($8.4 billion) supplementary budget plan to shore up the country’s export-reliant economy threatened by Donald Trump’s tariffs as officials prepare to head to the US to negotiate a lower duty.】

item.title: 中国制造玩具亿万富翁称关税将使美国玩具价格翻番
item.description: 玩具业亿万富翁尼克-莫伯雷（Nick Mowbray）说，唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税令他的公司 "瘫痪"，别无选择，只能提高在美国的零售价格。【原文：Toy billionaire Nick Mowbray said President Donald Trump’s tariffs have “paralyzed” his company and left it with little choice but to pump up retail prices in the US.】

item.title: 印度 UPI 支付平台目标新增 3 亿用户
item.description: 印度计划为其实时支付系统 "统一支付接口"（Unified Payments Interface）带来数以亿计的新用户，同时将该平台推广到海外。【原文：India plans to bring hundreds of millions of new users onto Unified Payments Interface, its real-time payments system, while pitching the platform for wider adoption overseas.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行称五月会议是重新审视政策的 "恰当时机
item.description: 澳大利亚央行在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）掀起关税浪潮之前召开了四月份会议，根据会议记录，澳大利亚央行对未来的降息表示谨慎，称五月将是重新审视政策设置的 "合适时机"。【原文：Australia’s central bank expressed caution over future interest-rate cuts, saying May would be an “opportune time” to revisit policy settings, according to minutes of its April meeting that was held just before US President Donald Trump’ unleashed a wave of tariffs that have roiled global markets.】

item.title: 亚洲汽车股因特朗普暂缓加征关税的迹象而反弹
item.description: 周二，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示正在考虑对进口汽车和汽车零部件实行关税豁免后，亚洲汽车制造商的股价攀升。【原文：Shares of Asian carmakers climbed Tuesday after US President Donald Trump said he was considering tariff exemptions on imported vehicles and auto parts.】

item.title: 首席执行官解释如何在 3 亿美元崩溃中伪造业绩
item.description:
Agritech风险企业eFishery曾是亚洲最耀眼的初创企业之一，获得了软银和淡马锡等机构的资金支持。然后一切都轰然倒塌了。【原文：

Agritech venture eFishery was one of Asia’s brightest startups with money from the likes of SoftBank and Temasek. Then it all came crashing down.

】

item.title: 日本加藤称不会在债券收益率飙升之际追加预算
item.description: 日本财务大臣排除了编制额外预算的想法，回击了推高日本国债收益率的市场猜测。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister ruled out the idea of compiling an extra budget, pushing back against market speculation that has driven up the nation’s government bond yields.】

item.title: 贸易战忧虑升温，黄金在历史记录下方企稳
item.description: 由于美国征收更多关税的计划激起了投资者的焦虑情绪，黄金坚挺在本周开盘创下的纪录高位下方。【原文：Gold held firm just below a record high set in the week’s opening session as US plans to impose more tariffs stoked investor anxiety.】

item.title: 关税生效后中国海运货物流量开始放缓
item.description: 上周，中国港口的货物吞吐量出现了自春节假期以来的首次放缓；如果这种趋势持续下去，将会削弱未来的出口价值。【原文：The volume of goods processed by Chinese ports slowed last week for the first time since the Lunar New Year holiday — a trend that will undercut the value of exports going forward if it continues.】

item.title: 美国大幅加征关税前数月中国经济可能增长 5.2
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税威胁到中国 5%左右的经济增长目标之前，如果没有更多的刺激措施，中国很可能会在 2025 年初报告稳健的经济增长。【原文：China will likely report solid economic growth for the start of 2025, a period before Donald Trump’s tariffs threaten its around 5% growth target without more stimulus.】

item.title: 专注非洲的 DPI 接管 Nclude，进军风险投资领域
item.description: 以非洲为重点的国际发展伙伴组织正在接管埃及的一家风险投资基金，以扩大对早期公司的投资。【原文：Africa-focused Development Partners International is taking over a venture capital fund in Egypt to expand into investing in early-stage companies.】

item.title: 英国消费者支出依然强劲，为经济增长带来希望
item.description: 英国零售商协会（British Retail Consortium）和巴克莱银行（Barclays）的报告显示，由于消费需求抵御了家庭账单即将上涨的压力，英国家庭在 3 月份增加了支出。【原文：UK households increased their spending in March as consumer demand defied an imminent rise in household bills, according to reports from the British Retail Consortium and Barclays.】

item.title: 贸易问题引发更多忧虑，美国期货下跌：市场综述
item.description: 白宫计划对半导体和药品进口征收关税，推动美国期货下跌，亚洲股市开盘谨慎。【原文：Asian stocks are poised for a cautious opening after White House plans to impose tariffs on semiconductor and pharmaceutical imports pushed US futures down.】

item.title: 关注关税举措和美伊谈判，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 石油在周一不温不火的交易时段后持稳，交易员们在关注美国在贸易战中的最新举措，以及对伊朗原油限制放宽的前景。【原文：Oil was steady after a tepid session on Monday, with traders monitoring the latest US moves in the trade war and the prospect of looser restrictions on Iranian crude.】

item.title: Clearlake 支持的 RSA Security 与债权人终止债务谈判
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Clearlake Capital Group 支持的 RSA Security 公司与其一组贷款人之间的秘密谈判因无法达成债务重组条款而破裂。【原文：Confidential talks between Clearlake Capital Group-backed RSA Security and a group of its lenders have fallen apart after terms on a debt restructuring couldn’t be reached, according to people with knowledge of the situation.】

item.title: 贝森特表示 "一切都在考虑之中"，向最富有者征税
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，共和党人正在研究所有方案，以帮助支付唐纳德-特朗普总统的减税竞选承诺，包括增加对最富有美国人的征税。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Republicans are looking at all options to help pay for President Donald Trump’s campaign promises on tax cuts, including increasing levies on the wealthiest Americans.】

item.title: 银湖为 Altera 交易安排 20 亿美元债务融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，银湖管理公司（Silver Lake Management）从英特尔公司收购可编程芯片公司 Altera 51% 的股份时，一批银行将为其提供 20 亿美元的债务。【原文：A group of banks is providing Silver Lake Management $2 billion in debt for its acquisition of a 51% stake in programmable chips unit Altera from Intel Corp., according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 康登特称黑客外泄 "有限 "客户文件
item.description: 业务流程服务公司 Conduent Inc. 说，一名黑客 "有限地 "进入了该公司的部分系统，并窃取了一些客户的文件。【原文：Conduent Inc., a business processes service, said a hacker gained access to a “limited” portion of the company’s systems and stole files for some clients.】

item.title: 应用材料公司收购芯片齿轮合作伙伴 Besi 公司 9% 的股份
item.description: 美国最大的芯片制造设备生产商应用材料公司（Applied Materials Inc.【原文：Applied Materials Inc., the largest US producer of chipmaking machinery, disclosed a 9% stake in BE Semiconductor Industries NV, its partner on a project with AI computing applications.】

item.title: 贝森特称财政部拥有庞大的工具箱，可满足债券市场的需要
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）淡化了近期债券市场的大跌，拒绝接受外国抛售所持美国国债的猜测，同时表示财政部拥有在必要时应对失调的工具。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent played down the recent selloff in the bond market, rejecting speculation that foreign nations were dumping their holdings of US Treasuries, while flagging that his department has tools to address dislocation if needed.】

item.title: 铜贸易商和制造商讨论智利冶炼厂的资金问题
item.description: 智利的 Enami 公司正在与有意为一个价值 14 亿多美元的冶炼项目融资的制造商和贸易公司进行谈判，因为这个顶级铜矿开采国希望阻止加工能力的下降。【原文：Chile’s Enami is in talks with manufacturers and trading firms interested in financing a $1.4 billion-plus smelting project as the top copper-mining nation looks to arrest a drop in processing capacity.】

item.title: 贝森特预计阿根廷有能力偿还中国掉期贷款
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，尽管美国政府不考虑向阿根廷提供任何直接信贷，但他预计阿根廷将有能力偿还与中国的掉期贷款。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he expects Argentina to be able to pay off its swap line with China, even though the US government isn’t considering providing the crisis-prone nation with any direct credit of its own.】

item.title: 安森美半导体撤回69亿美元收购Allegro的出价
item.description: 安森美半导体公司放弃了收购Allegro MicroSystems公司的努力，撤回了每股35.10美元的出价。【原文：ON Semiconductor Corp. scrapped efforts to acquire Allegro MicroSystems Inc., withdrawing a bid of $35.10 a share.】

item.title: 债券市场反弹缓解了受贸易战动荡影响的市场情绪
item.description: 自美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发动全球贸易战以来，市场经历了大幅下挫和异常剧烈的波动，华尔街周一终于得以喘息。【原文：Wall Street on Monday finally caught a respite from the deep selloffs and unusually sharp swings that have raced through markets ever since President Donald Trump unleashed his global trade war.】
